active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the risks of false positives in automated network isolation (e.g., legitimate traffic blocked) versus the benefits of rapid containment during a ransomware attack. Reference NIST SP 800-61 and real-world examples like SolarWinds.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Generate 3 plausible distractors based on: 1) Common misconceptions (e.g., confuse isolation with eradication); 2) Related but incorrect concepts (e.g., VLAN vs. full shutdown); 3) Partial truths (e.g., manual tools as automated); 4) Edge cases (e.g., false positives).
Ensure distractors are 70-80% similar to correct answer to challenge understanding.
Balance across Bloom's levels: 30% Remember/Understand, 40% Apply/Analyze, 30% Evaluate/Create.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Automated Network Isolation (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > Incident 002_Detection and Analysis > 015_Automation and Orchestration > Automated Detection Response > Automated Network Isolation). Use university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy objectives [insert learning_objectives array here], active learning for context [insert active_learning here], and 4-layer scaffolding [insert scaffolding here]. Completed Research Context: Automated network isolation auto-segments compromised assets via SOAR/EDR triggers to contain threats, reducing MTTR. NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 3 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/61/r3/final) integrates IR into CSF 2.0, emphasizing containment (DE.RS-05). NIST SP 800-207 Zero Trust (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/207/final) uses micro-segmentation for policy-enforced isolation. Tools: Palo Alto Cortex XSOAR, Cisco ISE, Ansible. Prior knowledge: Networking (VLANs, firewalls), IR phases. Big Picture: Fits NIST CSF Detect/Respond, accelerates to eradication/recovery. Sources: NIST SP 800-61 R3 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/61/r3/final), NIST SP 800-207 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/207/final), CSF 2.0 (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework). Generate 50 flashcards per flashcard_schema [insert schema here]. Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': {'question': '...', 'options': ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D']}, 'back': {'correct_answer': 'A', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': {'B': '...', ...}, 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': 1, 'source': '...'}}, ...].
